title: 11 Signs That You're Dating a Narcissist

steps.title: Someone with narcissistic qualities always has to be in control.
steps.content: Someone with narcissistic qualities always has to be in control. Before the date even starts, they’ve already decided on a time, place, and every detail in between. Sure, some people prefer to plan ahead instead of deciding everything the day of—but it’s a red flag if they take this sense of control to an extreme. [2] X Research source A careful planner might try to arrange the date ahead of time, but is ultimately willing to compromise with you on where and when the date will be. Someone who behaves in a narcissistic way, on the other hand, has a lot of trouble handing the reins over to another person. This individual might even order your meal and drink for you, and give the wait staff extra details on how the food needs to be cooked. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Your potential love match may take their date night attire to a whole new level.
steps.content: Your potential love match may take their date night attire to a whole new level. Sure, there’s nothing wrong with picking out a fun, stylish outfit when you’re meeting someone for the first time—but someone who tends toward narcissistic traits will take their outfits to an extreme. For example, you might be dressed in a fashionable but slightly casual ensemble while your date rocks a suit, gown, or another fancy outfit. These people truly take “dress to impress” to a whole new level. [4] X Research source Ultimately, someone with narcissistic qualities will want to create a great first impression by dressing up. [5] X Research source They also like to be on a pedestal above the people around them, which also explains the need to dress up. [6] X Research source Keep in mind that this trait likely stems from the deep insecurities that drive a person’s narcissistic behavior. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You may think that they’re trying to show off, but they’re really trying to hide how inferior and insecure they really feel.

steps.title: You may notice that your date can never settle for anything average or mediocre.
steps.content: You may notice that your date can never settle for anything average or mediocre. Well-known for their sense of entitlement, people with narcissistic tendencies automatically expect the best seats, tables, and services. Pay attention to how they act on the date, especially when you arrive at a new locale. [8] X Research source They might: Ask for a new table at the restaurant Be picky over seats at the movie theater Gripe when they don’t get the perfect parking spot

steps.title: A key symptom of narcissism is acting like others are “below” them.
steps.content: A key symptom of narcissism is acting like others are “below” them. This behavior usually happens because the narcissistic individual actually feels deeply inferior to others. That doesn’t make this behavior okay, however, and you might get an uncomfortable front-row seat to their apparent arrogance as they lash out at a waiter or leave a poor tip at the end of the date. [9] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You might notice that they: Complain that their food wasn’t cooked properly Ask the wait staff why the food is taking so long Be curt and rude to the wait staff whenever they ask for something

steps.title: If they seem too good to be true, they probably are.
steps.content: If they seem too good to be true, they probably are. Most people with diagnosed narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) are great at controlling the people around them, and won’t have any trouble making you feel comfortable and charmed after your time together. [10] X Research source Your date might even play the chivalry card by holding the door and grabbing your jacket once you reach your date location. [11] X Research source They might also: Flatter you with compliments Offer flirty comments Describe how special you are Just to be clear—there’s nothing wrong with someone being friendly and flirty on a date. Someone with narcissistic traits, however, will have their charm and flirtiness dialed up to 200%.

steps.title: People with NPD tend to bombard their dates with tons of affection and romance.
steps.content: People with NPD tend to bombard their dates with tons of affection and romance. These types of people approach the dating scene with their foot on the gas pedal, and make an effort to speed up the intensity of their relationship as soon as possible. [12] X Expert Source Jay Reid, LPCC Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor Expert Interview. 7 August 2020. They might say things like: “Wow, we might actually be soulmates.” “I think I’m in love with you.” “I can totally see myself spending the rest of my life with you.” Reader Poll: We asked 264 wikiHow readers for their most effective way to protect themselves from love bombing, and 55% of them said, recognizing and setting healthy boundaries. [Take Poll] So, take things slowly and set firm boundaries.

steps.title: People with narcissistic traits love to talk about themselves.
steps.content: People with narcissistic traits love to talk about themselves. Maybe you get to share one or two things about yourself before your date launches into story after story about themselves. [13] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source By the end of the outing, you feel like you’ve learned a lot about your date, but your date has learned very little about you. As a general rule of thumb, each person should talk for 20-30 seconds before giving the other person a chance to speak. [14] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source While there are obvious exceptions to this, it’s definitely a red flag if your date consistently dominates the conversation without giving you a chance to get a word in.

steps.title: Your date may constantly need to feel loved and appreciated.
steps.content: Your date may constantly need to feel loved and appreciated. At their core, people with diagnosed narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) are very insecure and struggle with really low self-esteem. These issues manifest in a need for compliments and constant appreciation. [15] X Research source Of course, they won’t ask for compliments outright. Instead, they’ll make subtle comments, like: “I must look like such a mess. I put this look together in 10 minutes.” “I don’t think I’m pulling off this outfit very well.” In making these comments, they're hoping you’ll say something like “No, you look great!” or “No, you’re rocking that outfit!”

steps.title: Someone with narcissistic tendencies needs to be admired and appreciated.
steps.content: Someone with narcissistic tendencies needs to be admired and appreciated. Bragging is simply a means of getting that admiration from others, even when they’re on a date. They thrive on your reactions and will do anything to keep that praise and appreciation coming, even if that means bending the truth about their accomplishments. [16] X Research source They might brag about: Where they live The school they go/went to How much money they make Well-known people they’re friends with

steps.title: Complaints are just another way for this person to stay in the spotlight.
steps.content: Complaints are just another way for this person to stay in the spotlight. Maybe your date complains about how their food is too cold, or how the music in the restaurant is too loud. Complaints are an easy, passive-aggressive way for them to center the conversation around themselves and their needs. [17] X Research source They might say: “Wow, I can’t believe we’ve had to wait 10 minutes already.” “This line for movie tickets is so long.” “I can’t believe the waiter hasn’t stopped by. It’s been 5 minutes!” Someone with a narcissistic personality may struggle with empathy and be genuinely unable to see things from other people’s perspectives. [18] X Expert Source Jay Reid, LPCC Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor Expert Interview. 7 August 2020.

steps.title: People with toxic behavior patterns have trouble settling down with a long-term partner.
steps.content: People with toxic behavior patterns have trouble settling down with a long-term partner. See if your date chats about their previous partnerships, or what they’re hoping to get out of a new relationship. Their typical relationship might go through multiple “cycles” or phases: idealization , where they jack up the intensity of the relationship; devaluation , where they treat their partner like a second-class citizen; and discarding , where they either break-up or separate themselves from the relationship. If you’re on a date with someone who’s demonstrating narcissistic behaviors, they probably don’t have a great, long-term track record with their past partners. [19] X Expert Source Jay Reid, LPCC Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor Expert Interview. 7 August 2020. Most relationships that involve someone with narcissistic tendencies will follow this cycle. In some cases, the person will go back to the “idealization” phase to get their partner hooked back into the relationship. Keep in mind that getting out of a short relationship doesn’t automatically mean someone has narcissistic tendencies—and you should always avoid labeling someone as a narcissist unless they’ve been officially diagnosed. [20] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source There are lots of reasons a relationship can go south—what you’re looking for is a pattern of negative behavior.
